history.text: Hello!
Hi how are you?
Fine, thank you. What do you think about the 1990 American comedy film "Home Alone"?
I like it. I think Macaulay Culkin was hilarious in it.
I think it's one of the most memorable and all in all beautiful motion pictures ever.
I totally agree with you.
John Hughes has a lot of memorable films, including this one.
And the other actors like Joe Pesci and Daniel Stern who play the burglar played their role extremely well.
its such a simple plot too. even though its unrealistic. its almost all in the title.
What do you think about the overall plot?
Yes, that is true!
Do you like comedy movies?
its basic, and you have to suspend some disbelief (as in the parents would have noticed much sooner), but its really well executed. I like comedy movies in general.
what did you think of the scene where they miss the alarm and have to scramble to get to the airport?
Yeah well the McCalliter family forgetting their youngest son is a bit too much but most viewers get past that. I love the dynamic of the family in the day of departure.
I could totally imagine them getting out the door without him in a panic.
Hmm, that's basically the whole pretext of why they forgot Kevin. Even if it was forced.
Also the power outage contributes to the disaster by resetting the alarm clocks so the family oversleeps.
Do you agree with the rating of the movie?
I think the ratings are surprisingly low. Its not the smartest film, but I think the ratings don't really reflect the sentiment
Yes, I'd have too agree. The movie just sort of has a magic to it which the critical response doesn't really get.
Another crucial moment is when the mom (Kate) discovers mid-flight that they left Kevin behind.
The mom's trek back to kevin is also kinda funny. its like its own little side journey
Yeah that's were that journey begins.
in real life I would have imagined that she would call a friend or relative to check in on him. but that wouldn't have been as good a movie
I guess that's true!
flying to and from chicago during the holdiays is such a nightmare too
I would imagine!
Anyways, the middle and final part of the movie are the reason it's so popular and loved.
when kevin starts setting up traps for the burglars is where the movie really starts to shine
True! The way he rigs those traps and plans everything is amazing. Almost unbelivable for a 8 year old !
I think thats why the movie is loved. every kid can relate to the situation (at least in their imagination!)
What do you think about the moments when he almost got caught? What did you think will happen?
its a nailbiter for  a stretch or two there.
And being a comedy, in the end, the bad guys get busted because the police get there and the family is reunited with Kevin.
Do you generally prefer movies with good or bad rating? Is it relevant to you?
When Kevin has to answer for messing up Buzz's stuff its pretty funny.
Ratings can sometimes be relevant....
I agree! That is so true!
Although I prefer to know something about a movie before watching it
Oh, you left, goodbye then!
I think we're finished anyway.
